info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 11 at 3:11PM MST until August 11 at 6:15PM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The National Weather Service in Las Vegas has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Mohave County in northwestern Arizona... * Until 615 PM MST. * At 311 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing very heavy rainfall from Peach Springs south to just north of Wikieup. In addition to the potential for flash flooding, frequent cloud to ground lightning and very low visibility is expected with these heavy downpours. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Valentine, Diamond M Ranch and Peach Springs. Motorists traveling along or near the Interstate 40 corridor between Fort Rock and the Highway 93 interchange could see sudden reductions of driving visibility and result in a hazard for drivers. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
